definition: to open wide
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
dog hole wide open (idiom); fig. gap caused by missing teeth (used mockingly)
see 開齋節|开斋节[Kai1 zhai1 jie2]
imaginative/to have one's mind buzzing with ideas

sentences.english: And that's the reason why the Fed has decided on the second round of its money printing plan.
sentences.chinese: 这就是为何美联储决定第二次大开印钞机的原因。

sentences.english: Li Zhongzheng back and found the gates open, they hurriedly drove past view.
sentences.chinese: 李中正回城后发现城门大开，他们慌忙赶过去查看。

sentences.english: That night, she had an eye-opening experience.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上，她有个眼界大开的经历。

sentences.english: Each saw the plate melon, I immediately opened the appetite.
sentences.chinese: 每一看到那盘瓜，我顿时食欲大开。

sentences.english: I am sure this food will whet their appetites.
sentences.chinese: 我敢肯定，这些菜能让他们大开胃口。

sentences.english: Do you believe they can hope in someday gaining sight and freedom?
sentences.chinese: 你相信他们希望有一天会眼界大开，获得自由吗？

sentences.english: She pulls the bag open wide so her great-grandmother can see inside. "Oh, my favorite."
sentences.chinese: 她把袋子拽得大开，好让太婆看到里面的东西。

sentences.english: Living in another country can be a real eye-opener.
sentences.chinese: 生活在另外一个国家真让人眼界大开。

sentences.english: This Sichuan hot-pot really works up my appetite.
sentences.chinese: 这个四川火锅真是吃得我胃口大开。

sentences.english: My mother drove me to the flight terminis with the windows rolled down.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈开车送我去的机场，一路上车窗都大开着。

sentences.english: The river gates are flying open. The palace falls down and cracks.
sentences.chinese: 河门突然大开，宫殿就此被倒塌冲毁。

sentences.english: Just hearing these names is mouth-watering.
sentences.chinese: 光听名字我就已经胃口大开了。

sentences.english: The city is also hot and humid, so windows are left open or air-conditioners whirr away day and night.
sentences.chinese: 而当地天气湿热，窗户常常大开，空调日夜运转。

sentences.english: I don't think Joe is a great lion.
sentences.chinese: 我认为乔没有大开狮子口。

definition: to be wide open
to open wide/unrestrictedly
entrance/door/gate/large and influential family
the Doors, US rock band
to swarm in (of people etc) (idiom)
to close securely/tightly closed/secure
to walk in in a line
(of a perfume or a foul odor) permeating the whole place/(of grease etc) dripping everywhere/flowing all over the place
to close (a door)/to turn off (light, electrical equipment etc)
one after another (idiom)/in quick succession
to spill/to overflow (of water, crowds)/to crowd (into a space)
to soar/to rocket
to be full to overflowing/to be brimming over with
to turn up without being invited/unsolicited
to rush out
full of joy (idiom); jubilation
the eight points of the compass/all directions
